## open science

A collection of actions designed to

-   make scientific processes more **transparent** and their
-   results more **accessible** (Spellman et al. , 2018)

## transparency

-   shows all steps of the scientific process
-   provides details of study process
-   avoids filtering by results
    -   research flexibility
    -   publication bias

. . .

![](images/cherrypicking_girl.jpg){.absolute bottom="40" right="10" width="500"}

## accessibility

-   preregistration
-   material
-   data
-   analysis scripts
-   preprint

## preregistration

-   research recipe
-   reduce research flexibility
-   check feasibility before collecting data
-   save time and effort
-   [OSF](https://osf.io/) (Open science framework)
    -   [own example](https://osf.io/psrjf)
-   Registered Report
    -   preregistration with a journal
    -   in-principle acceptance

## sharing data/material

-   data reuse: study as data-point in a future meta-analysis (Lakens et al., 2016)
-   consider ethics/waste in **not** sharing

. . .

![](images/data-sharing%20cartoon.jpg){.absolute bottom="50" right="0" width="300"}

-   plan ahead for data sharing ([FAIR](https://www.go-fair.org/fair-principles/))
-   ethics (GDPR)
-   data storage
    -   [SUB support](https://www.su.se/staff/researchers/research-data/manage-store-data)
    -   [figshare Stefan project](https://su.figshare.com/articles/dataset/Open_data_Electrophysiological_correlates_of_in-vivo_and_virtual_reality_therapy_in_spider_phobia/14891607)
